Authors: TodNaz

name: tida.betterc.runtime
tida.betterc.window
tida.color
comment:
Color description module. Contains a structure for manipulating colors like RGB, there,
    and other ways to set colors. Mostly the RGB format is used, and the use of other formats
    will be converted to RGB.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: grayscale
members.comment:
Converts grayscale to the library's standard color scheme.

    Params:
        gsc = Grayscale value.

    Example:
    ---
    auto color = grayscale(128);
    ---

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: rgb
members.comment:
Creates an RGB color.

    Params:
        r = Red.
        g = Green.
        b = Blue.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: rgba
members.comment:
Creates an RGBA color.

    Params:
        r = Red.
        g = Green.
        b = Blue.
        a = Alpha.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: toRGB
members.comment:
Convert HSL to RGBA color.

    Params:
        str = HSL color.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: toRGB
members.comment:
Convert HSB to RGBA color.

    Params:
        str = HSB color.

    Returns: RGBA

members.name: this
members.type: @safe (T red, T green, T blue, T alpha = T.max)

members.comment:
Converts a color to the specified type and format.

        Params:
            T = Type.
            format = Pixel format.
members.name: conv

members.comment:
Converts a color to a sequence of bytes in the specified format.

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.

        Returns: Sequence of bytes.
members.name: fromBytes

name: tida.event
comment:
Event handler module.

members.comment:
Initializes an event handler.

members.name: update
members.comment:
Updates the event queue. Returns whether there are events in the queue.
        On each call, the queue is advanced.

members.name: isKeyDown
members.comment: Returns a state indicating whether a key is pressed.

members.name: isKeyUp
members.comment: Returns a state indicating whether a key is released.

members.name: isResize
members.comment: Returns whether the window has been resized.

members.name: resizeWindowSize
members.comment: Returns whether the window has been resized.

tida.fps

name: tida.game.animation
comment:
Module for describing animation.

	Authors: TodNaz
	License: MIT

members.name: isRepeat
members.comment: Whether the animation needs to be repeated.

members.name: strip
members.comment:
Creates frames from one sample picture.

		Params:
			image = The picture from where the frames will be received.
			x = The beginning of the cut by x-axis.
			y = The beginning of the cut by y-axis.
			w = Width frames.
			h = Height frames.

		Example:
		---
		anim.strip(new Image("atlas.png"),0,0,32,32);
		---

name: tida.game.collision
tida.game.sprite
comment: A module for describing the rendering of image or animation.

members.name: Sprite
members.comment: A object for describing the rendering of image or animation.

members.name: isAnimation
members.comment: Whether it is necessary to display animation, or a static picture.

members.name: angle
members.comment: The rotation angle of the sprite.

members.name: width
members.comment: The width of the sprite. If zero, the value is taken from the rendered image.

members.name: height
members.comment: The height of the sprite. If zero, the value is taken from the rendered image.

members.name: position
members.comment: The pivot point of the sprite.

members.name: skelet
members.comment: An array of other sprites to create a single picture.

name: tida.graph.image
comment:
A module for describing an image. This module provides control
    of the image both with a surface and with a texture.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a surface with the specified size. Note that it is
        not yet a texture, and you dont need to draw it right away,
        to do this, convert it to a texture.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image width.
            newHeight = Image height.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Loads a surface from a file. Supported formats are described here:
        `https://code.dlang.org/packages/imageformats`

        Params:
            path = Relative or full path to the image file.

Gives a sequence of bytes that encodes a color in
        the specified color format.

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.
members.name: bytes

members.comment:
Returns a sequence of pixels in the format `0xRRGGBBAA` (Depending on the format).

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.
members.name: colors
setPixel
members.comment:
Set the pixel at the specified location.

        Params:
            x = The x-axis position pixel.
            y = The y-axis position pixel.
            color = Pixel.
members.originalType: @trusted void(size_t x, size_t y, Color!ubyte color)

members.name: getPixel
members.comment:
Returns the pixel at the specified location.

        Params:
            x = The x-axis position pixel.
            y = The y-axis position pixel.

members.name: blit
members.comment: Attaches an image to itself at the specified position.

members.name: create
members.comment:
Creates a surface with the specified size. Note that it is
        not yet a texture, and you dont need to draw it right away,
        to do this, convert it to a texture.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image width.
            newHeight = Image height.

members.name: load
members.comment:
Loads a surface from a file. Supported formats are described here:
        `https://code.dlang.org/packages/imageformats`

        Params:
            path = Relative or full path to the image file.

members.name: isTexture
members.comment: Whether the picture is a texture.

members.name: fromTexture
members.comment: Convert to a texture for rendering to the window.

members.name: dup
members.comment: Creates a copy of the picture. Doesn't create a copy of the texture.

members.name: drawEx
members.originalType: void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, float angle, Vecf center, Vecf size, ubyte alpha)

members.name: drawColor
members.originalType: void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, Color!ubyte color)

members.name: freeTexture
members.comment: Destroys the texture, not the image.

members.name: freePixels
members.comment: Frees up space for pixels. Does not destroy texture.

members.name: free
members.comment: Frees memory completely from texture and pixels.

Module for drawing in a window using opengl.

Module for system information.

members.comment: Returns the width of the monitor.

members.name: getHeight
members.comment: Returns the height of the monitor.

name: tida.runtime
comment:
Runtime module. Serves to save some globally significant variables in the library.

    To create a runtime, you just need to call one function for this:
    ---
    TidaRuntime.initialize(args);
    ---

    So it will automatically remember the program arguments and create all the
    conditions for creating a window.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: initialize
members.comment: Creates and initializes a runtime for the program.

members.name: args
members.comment: Returns the arguments that were passed at runtime.

members.name: display
members.comment: Returns a display open in x11 environment.

members.name: xDisplayOpen
members.comment: Opens the display in x11 environment.

name: tida.scene
tida.scene.component
tida.scene.instance
comment:
A module for describing an object in the game.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: shape
members.init: Shape(cast(ShapeType)0, null, nanF, Vector(0.0F, 0.0F), Vector(0.0F, 0.0F), Vector(0.0F, 0.0F))

members.name: id
members.comment: The reserved place in the array in the scene.

members.name: threadId
members.comment: Which thread the instance is running on.

members.name: active
members.comment:
Instance activity. If you set this variable to `false`,
            then all events will not be processed, i.e. the object
            will actually be frozen.

members.name: visible
members.comment:
Object visibility. If it is set to `false`, then the
            rendering of the sprite and the` draw` event will not
            be processed.

members.name: persistent
members.comment:
Allows you to move the instance link to another
            scene upon transition. Turns on once.

members.name: solid
members.comment: Maybe the object collides with others

members.name: withDraw
members.comment: Tell the scene to only draw it.

members.name: Instance
members.comment: A object for describing an object in the game.

members.name: mask
members.init: Shape(cast(ShapeType)0, null, nanF, Vector(0.0F, 0.0F), Vector(0.0F, 0.0F), Vector(0.0F, 0.0F))

members.name: id
members.comment: The reserved place in the array in the scene.

members.name: threadID
members.comment: Which thread the instance is running on.

members.name: active
members.comment:
Instance activity. If you set this variable to `false`,
            then all events will not be processed, i.e. the object
            will actually be frozen.

members.name: visible
members.comment:
Object visibility. If it is set to `false`, then the
            rendering of the sprite and the` draw` event will not
            be processed.

members.name: persistent
members.comment:
Allows you to move the instance link to another
            scene upon transition. Turns on once.

members.name: solid
members.comment: Maybe the object collides with others

members.name: withDraw
members.comment: Tell the scene to only draw it.

members.name: sort
members.comment:
Cause the sorting facilities.

        Please note that this action will be performed in the next step.

members.name: destroy
members.comment:
Indicates that it is time to destroy this instance.

        Please note that this action will be performed in the next step.

members.name: add
members.comment:
Adds a component to an instance.

        Params:
            cmp = Component.

Returns the component by its class component.

        Params:
            T = Class.

        Example:
        ---
        instance.add!Gravity;
        instance.of!Gravity.F = 0.1f;
        ---
members.name: of

members.comment:
Return the component by its name.

        Params:
            name = Component name.
members.name: of
of
members.comment:
Return the component by its name.

        Params:
            name = Component name.

members.name: init
members.comment:
This event is fired once when control is first transferred
        to the scene. The next time control is transferred, this
        event will not be triggered.
        Note:
            It's useless to use `sceneManager.current` to grab the current
            instance, since this link will enter into the previous scene.
            For real it is better to use `sceneManager.initable`.

members.name: restart
members.comment:
This event will be triggered when control is not transferred
        to the scene for the first time. The first time will not be
        called.
        Note:
            It's useless to use `sceneManager.current` to grab the current
            instance, since this link will enter into the previous scene.
            For real it is better to use `sceneManager.initable`.

members.name: entry
members.comment:
This event is always called when control is transferred to the scene.
        Note:
            It's useless to use `sceneManager.current` to grab the current
            instance, since this link will enter into the previous scene.
            For real it is better to use `sceneManager.initable`.

members.name: event
members.comment:
This event will be triggered when the user enters something.
        This does not mean that it is equivalent to `step`.

members.name: step
members.comment:
This event is called always and constantly at the rate of the specified
        frame counter. Also, when new threads are declared and the instance is
        redefined in a different thread, this event will run on a different thread.

members.name: draw
members.comment:
This event is for drawing something on the screen.
        Params:
            graph = Instance to render.

members.name: drawDebug
members.comment:
This event is intended for rendering in debug mode.
        Params:
            graph = Instance to render.

members.name: gameExit
members.comment:
This event will be triggered when the game is closed by the user or
        the program.

members.name: gameRestart
members.comment: This event will be triggered when the game is restarted by the program.

members.name: gameStart
members.comment: This event will be triggered when the game is launched with `game.run`.

members.name: trigger
members.comment:
This event is fired when someone has thrown a trigger.
        Params:
            oftrigger = Trigger name.

members.name: onError
members.comment: This event will be thrown when any exception is thrown.

members.name: eventDestroy
members.comment: This event will be triggered when the instance is destroyed.

members.name: collision
members.comment: This event will be triggered when this instance collides with someone.

name: tida.scene.manager
comment:
Scene manager module.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: ofbegin
members.comment:
The first added scene.

        It can be overridden so that when the game
        is restarted, the manager will jump to the
        scene from this line:
        ---
        sceneManager.ofbegin = myScene;
        sceneManager.gameRestart();
        ---

members.name: previous
members.comment: The previous scene that was active.

members.name: current
members.comment:
Link to the currently active scene. With the help of it,
        it will be convenient for the instances to communicate
        with the scene.
            For more convenient communication, there
        is a function `getScene`, by which you can access the
        functions of the heir, but the main thing is to check
        the correctness of the scene, otherwise you can get
        an error:
        ---
        sceneManager.current.getScene!HeirScene.callback();
        ---

members.name: initable
members.comment:
Temporary reference during initialization. Use it only
        in the `init`,` restart`, `entry` events. Contains a
        link to the current scene, which will be initialized
        (i.e., control is transferred).

members.name: trigger
members.comment:
Calls a trigger for the current scene, as well as its instances.

        Params:
            name = Trigger name.

members.name: hasScene
members.comment:
Checks if the scene is in the scene list.

        Params:
            scene = Scene.

members.name: add
members.comment:
Adds a scene to the list.

        Params:
            scene = Scene.

Creates and adds a scene to the list.

        Params:
            T = Scene name.

        Example:
        ---
        sceneManager.add!MyScene;
        ---
members.name: add
inbegin
members.comment: Goes to the first scene added.

members.name: gotoin
members.comment:
Goes to the scene by its string name.

        Params:
            name = Scene name.

members.name: gotoin
members.comment:
Goes to the scene by his heir name.

        Params:
            scene = Scene heir.

name: tida.scene.scene
comment:
A module for describing a scene in the play space.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: remove
members.type: nothrow @trusted void(ref T[] obj, size_t index)

members.name: getThreadList
members.comment:
Returns a buffer of instances from the stream.

        Params:
            index = Thread id.

members.name: isThreadExists
members.comment:
Is there such a stream buffer.

        Params:
            index = Thread id.

members.name: add
members.comment:
Adds an instance to the scene for interpreting its actions.

        Params:
            instance = Instance.
            threadID = In which thread to add execution.

in.name: __require
in.originalType: @safe void(ref Instance instance, ref size_t threadID)

members.comment:
Creates and adds an instance to the scene.

        Params:
            Name = Name class.
            threadID = In which thread to add execution.

        Note:
            There must be no arguments in the constructor.
members.name: add
add
members.comment:
Adds multiple instances at a time.

        Params:
            instances = Instances.
            threadID = In which thread to add execution.

Adds multiple instances at a time.

        Params:
            Names = Names instances.
            threadID = In which thread to add execution.
members.name: add
getErentInstances
members.comment: Returns a sorted list of instances.

members.name: hasInstance
members.comment:
Whether this instance is on the list.

        Params:
            instance = Instance.

Removes an instance from the list and, if a delete method is
        specified in the template, from memory.

        Params:
            type = Type destroy.
            instance = Instance.

        Type:
            `InScene`  - Removes only from the scene, does not free memory.
            `InMemory` - Removes permanently, from the scene and from memory
                         (by the garbage collector).
members.name: instanceDestroy
init
members.comment:
Scene initialization

        * Needed if you need to initialize something,
          when the scene becomes active.

members.name: restart
members.comment:
Reinitialization.

        * If the scene was previously initialized,
          then this method is called.

members.name: step
members.comment:
Scene step

        * Only active when the scene
          becomes active
        * It does not require implementation.

members.name: event
members.comment:
Event handling

        * Valid only when the scene
          becomes active.
        * It does not require implementation.

members.name: trigger
members.comment:
Called when a trigger is activated.

        Params:
            oftrigger = Trigger name.

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Drawing on the surface.

        * Valid only when the scene
          becomes active
        * It does not require implementation.

members.name: gameExit
members.comment: It runs regardless of which scene is active.

members.name: gameRestart
members.comment:
If game restart - call self
        It runs regardless of which scene is active.

members.name: gameStart
members.comment: It runs regardless of which scene is active.

members.name: eventDestroy
members.comment:
Object destruction event. Called then
        when an object requires it to be deleted. The scene will do it
        but you can do something with her before that.
        (how bawdy, yomayo).

members.name: onError
members.comment: Will be called when an exception occurs.

members.name: drawDebug
members.comment:
This event is intended for rendering in debug mode.

        Params:
            graph = Instance to render.

members.name: x
members.comment: The beginning of the figure along the x-axis.

name: tida.window
comment:
A module for working with windows in a cross-platform environment.
    A window is created in both Windows and Linux environments. OS X
    and other operating systems are currently not supported due to
    lack of testing on these platforms.

    The window is created primarily not in the constructor, in the constructor
    the window parameters are initialized for its creation. All this is created
    by the `initialize` method, with an indication of the template parameter,
    which window to create.

    A window can be created either with a ready-made context or without it
    (i.e., created manually)(Please note that the context is strictly created
    only for the opengl library).

    Creating a simple window is done with a simple `initialize` function:
    ---
    /*
        We just allocate memory for the window, this is not yet the
        stages of its creation.
    */
    Window window = new Window(640,480,"MyTitle");

    /*
        Creates a simple window with no graphics context.
    */
    window.initialize!Simple;
    ---

    There are two ways to create a context:
    1. Initialize the window immediately with the context:
    ---
    window.initialize!ContextIn;
    ---
    2. Create it manually:
    ---
    window.initialize!Simple;

    Context context = new Context();

    /*
        Indicates the attributes of the context.
    */
    context.attrib = GLAttributes(...);
    context.attribInitialize(window);
    context.initialize(window);

    /*
        Sets the context to this window.
    */
    window.contextSet(context);
    ---

    Then you can draw something on the window, control it and so on.

    Also, please note that creating multiple windows is currently not supported.

    TODO:
        * Make it possible to create several windows at the same time.
          Namely, to make `shared` methods for working in different threads,
          both for the window and for the context, event handler and render.

        * Make normal full screen and resize. The fact is that when the size
          is changed, the render is not updated, even if you do a redraw.
          Apparently, the nodes allocate a buffer.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: Simple
members.comment:
A property to create just a window, without creating a context.
    Initialize it like this:
    ---
    window.initialize!Simple;
    ---

members.name: ContextIn
members.comment:
Property for creating a window with a context for graphics.
    It is initialized like this:
    ---
    window.initialize!ContextIn;
    ---

members.name: ParrarelContext
members.comment: Property for creating a window on another thread. It is not used now.

members.name: Empty
members.comment: The shell is empty. Only needed in WebAssembly mode.

members.name: Context
members.comment: Class for describing and creating context for the window.

members.name: xAttribInitialize
members.comment:
Initializes the context parameters in the x11 environment.

        All parameters are taken from the attrib variable. The default will always be double buffering.

members.name: xContextInitialize
members.comment: Creates a context in the x11 environment.

members.name: attribInitialize
members.comment: Initializes the parameters of the context.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Initialization of window parameters.

        Note:
            * The window will not be created, but the parameters for its creation will be initialized.

        Params:
            newWidth = The width of the window when created.
            newHeight = The height of the window when created.
            newTitle = The title of the window when created.

Initializes the window according to the parameters.

        A window can be created with the following parameters:
        * `Simple` - Will create a simple window with no context when
                     you need to manually create it.
        * `ContextIn` - Creates a window with a context for graphics.

        Params:
            Type = What type of window to initialize.
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.
members.name: initialize
xWindowInit
members.comment:
Initializes the window for the context.

        Params:
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.
            visual = Information from context for create window.

members.name: xWindowSimpleInitialize
members.comment:
Created simple window in environment x11.

        Params:
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.

members.name: contextSet
members.comment:
Sets an _initialized_ context.

        Params:
            context = Initialized context.

members.name: xContextSet
members.comment: Sets an _initialized_ context of x11 environment.

members.name: xResize
members.originalType: @trusted void(immutable uint newWidth, immutable uint newHeight)

members.name: xMove
members.originalType: @trusted void(immutable int posX, immutable int posY)

members.name: move
members.comment:
Moves the window to the specified location.

        Params:
            posX = New X-axis position window.
            posY = New Y-axis position window.
members.originalType: @safe void(immutable int posX, immutable int posY)

in.name: __require
in.originalType: @safe void(ref immutable int posX, ref immutable int posY)

members.name: resize
members.comment:
Resizes the window.

        Params:
            newWidth = Window width.
            newHeight = Window height.
members.originalType: @safe void(immutable uint newWidth, immutable uint newHeight)

in.name: __require
in.originalType: @safe void(ref immutable uint newWidth, ref immutable uint newHeight)

comment:
Module for importing x11 libraries.
